result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (8th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (8th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Karl L. JOHNSON was found guilty of OWI (8th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: concurrent to the sentences defendant is currently serving on any or all cases 09 CF 243, 09 CF 242, or 09 CF 225.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, school, job search or combination.
AODA assessment and counseling and Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Transcript of sentencing hearing held on 01-27-15.
Copy of transcript of sentencing hearing mailed to Registrar at Dodge Correctional Institution.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Wisconsin State Prison and Extended Supervision.   Duplicate original delivered to Registrar.  Copy to DOC and Sheriff.

Defendant in custody.   
Count 1 - Operate under influence (8th) - Guilty plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, operate w/PAC over.02% and count 3, OAR.  Motion granted.  Defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total sentence of seven (7) years, three (3) years initial confinement, followed by four (4) years extended supervision.  The sentence is to be concurrent to the sentences defendant is currently serving on any or all cases 09 CF 243, 09 CF 242, or 09 CF 225.  Conditions of extended supervision are:
1) Pay $1,400.00 fine, plus costs, total of $2,781.00; 
2) AODA assessment and follow through counseling including Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan;
3) Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process;
4) Maintain full-time work, school, job search or combination;
5) Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC.  
Court further imposes a thirty-six (36) month license revocation and ignition interlock for the period of revocation.  
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarcertion Program and the Substance Abuse Program..  
Defendant is given credit for 95 days time served.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of OWI - 8th offense.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-03-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the  Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
